intro: Disciphania modesta, commonly known as the small disciphania, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa. It belongs to the family Violaceae, which includes violets and related species. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of purple or white. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, contributing to its ornamental appeal.
